title: Snoop Dogg and Dr. Dre Release New Single “Outta Da Blue”: Stream
description: Plus, Snoop is set to headline the season finale of Amazon Music Live following Black Friday NFL Game between the Raiders and Chiefs. Snoop Dogg and Dr. Dre Release New Single “Outta Da Blue”: Stream Jo Vito
author: Jo Vito
excerpt: Snoop Dogg and Dr. Dre have released “Outta Da Blue,” the latest song from their upcoming album Missionary. Stream the new single.
text: Snoop Dogg and Dr. Dre have released “Outta Da Blue,” the latest single from their upcoming collaborative album, Missionary. Featuring Alus, “Outta Da Blue” sees Snoop and Dre trade verses over a booming beat, produced by Dre, Dem Jointz, BoogzDaBeast, and FNZ. On the chorus, Alus delivers a memorable hook that references the album’s title, Missionary, and then interpolates the gun-shooting, money-taking refrain from M.I.A.’s 2007 hit, “Paper Planes.” Get Snoop Dogg Tickets Here Arriving via Death Row, Aftermath, and Interscope, “Outta Da Blue” is the second single to arrive from Missionary, following the Jhené Aiko-featuring track “Gorgeous,” which arrived earlier this month. Before its release, “Outta Da Blue” was previewed by Snoop and Dre on a live episode of Drink Champs, and was also used in the trailer for the upcoming Netflix film, Back in Action. Stream “Outta Da Blue” below. Missionary itself is due on December 13th, and will mark the first full-length collaboration between Snoop and Dre since their iconic 1993 album, Doggystyle. In other Snoop Dogg news, it was recently announced that he will perform a concert for an episode of Amazon Music Live on Black Friday after the NFL football game between the Las Vegas Raiders and the Kansas City Chiefs. The episode will be broadcast on Prime Video and Twitch at 7:00 p.m. ET on Black Friday (November 29th), and will feature a setlist including classic hits, tracks from Missionary, and more. After that, Snoop is booked for a one-off show at the Thunder Valley Casino in Lincoln, California on December 27th. Get tickets here.
html:
Snoop Dogg and Dr. Dre have released “Outta Da Blue,” the latest single from their upcoming collaborative album, Missionary.

Featuring Alus, “Outta Da Blue” sees Snoop and Dre trade verses over a booming beat, produced by Dre, Dem Jointz, BoogzDaBeast, and FNZ. On the chorus, Alus delivers a memorable hook that references the album’s title, Missionary, and then interpolates the gun-shooting, money-taking refrain from M.I.A.’s 2007 hit, “Paper Planes.”

Get Snoop Dogg Tickets Here

Arriving via Death Row, Aftermath, and Interscope, “Outta Da Blue” is the second single to arrive from Missionary, following the Jhené Aiko-featuring track “Gorgeous,” which arrived earlier this month. Before its release, “Outta Da Blue” was previewed by Snoop and Dre on a live episode of Drink Champs, and was also used in the trailer for the upcoming Netflix film, Back in Action. Stream “Outta Da Blue” below.

Missionary itself is due on December 13th, and will mark the first full-length collaboration between Snoop and Dre since their iconic 1993 album, Doggystyle.

In other Snoop Dogg news, it was recently announced that he will perform a concert for an episode of Amazon Music Live on Black Friday after the NFL football game between the Las Vegas Raiders and the Kansas City Chiefs. The episode will be broadcast on Prime Video and Twitch at 7:00 p.m. ET on Black Friday (November 29th), and will feature a setlist including classic hits, tracks from Missionary, and more.

After that, Snoop is booked for a one-off show at the Thunder Valley Casino in Lincoln, California on December 27th. Get tickets here.
